text:
[Section: Subject: Dad on the Eastside in 2024]



Per our discussion, I think this is what we discussed and additional ideas I had. Open to feedback. As mentioned,
we can use the moving service app for some quick hits and then work on a longer-term plan. We also need to

figure out the former love nest clean/move.
Shared Furniture to minimize cash outlay
TVs : Sitting room & Deck (might ask to swap one for living room TV).
Furniture: I will move our sitting room and guest room stuff to new place
Patio: We agree it's not used, so I will take, but we can truly divide in mediation.
Grills: Happy to share these if you like. The beach grill would be great for ya.
Misc: bean bag? exercise stuff? art? pillows? desk? Is there anything in the man cave?
Kitchen: Realistic division of shared assets, I think you are working on that
Decorations: We can work together in the near term and use long-term mediation.
Linens/Towels: I have a bunch from the beach, but I will want nice stuff. Suggestions?
Other furniture for consideration
Master bedroom: I can use beach stuff as a temp option. We swap the mattresses
Dining Table: I can use the beach one as a temp. The chairs have to go, though.
Beach Couch/Chair: I'll keep my chair and use the couch till we get something better.
Beach Bean Bag: I'll find a place to use that somewhere, do we have an extra at home?
Kids bedroom set: I can use the one at the beach for AD, and use the guest for Max
One kid's desk: We need two. I'll take the beach one and find a new one (1210 or Craigslist)
TV room sectional. You keep ours. I will rent or buy. Hopefully, it's the only cash outlay.
Kids "fun stuff" I may think about
Electronics: PCs, Monitors, gaming (we have some of this)
Play: CL or Amazon "Pop a shot" game?
Play: CL or Amazon Basketball hoop?
Play: CL or Amazon Ping Pong table?
Pets: Fish/Gerbils/Cat/Dog?
I want to be super clear- I still prefer to nest as we said. This will be much more expensive. But, I understand your concerns
and wish things that happened since July had not happened, making it so hard. But I still want to work with you so we are
not forced to do dumb fiscal things again.
Subject: Re: Dad on the Eastside in 2024
From: Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>
To: christine moyer <christinemoyer@hotmail.com>
Date Sent: Sunday, January 14, 2024 7:37:36 AM GMT-08:00
<< I am using email just for this to maintain the discussion and make it readable. This will remain only a discussion on
move items. There will be zero narrative or side discussion. Everything else should be on OFW. And I will copy past this
there as well, but I don't think it will make sense to use that as our platform to finalize this list. Thank you>>
There is a lot of stuff here. I don't think it will all make it. If you can look through this list. Let me know what you think. If
we agree, I can distill it into one manageable, prioritized list to share and agree to. I appreciate the help and cooperation.

Original "Split List"
Subject: Re: Dad on the Eastside in 2024
From: Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>
To: christine moyer <christinemoyer@hotmail.com>
Date Sent: Tuesday, January 2, 2024 11:41:01 PM GMT-08:00
I know this goes without saying, but given the escalation this afternoon, I want to be sure we are clear that my stuff is my
stuff. Feel free to divvy up community stuff as mentioned but my private things, my clothes, things in the dresser, things in
my areas of the closet, etc... are my private things. We have agreed we would show each other dignity and respect and
acknowledge the other's space. So please do not go through, move, or otherwise mess with my personal things. I would
never do that to you, and in fact, did not even fix the GFI when you were gone because I was respectful of your clothes, and
I would have to move them to do it. So I made a temp fix and told you I would wait till you returned. As I said, I'm sure you
would never touch my private things and then expect me to respect yours, but it's worth noting, given how nuts this has
become and your ability to adhere to the same rules. Agreed?

Subject: Fwd: Dad on the Eastside in 2024
From: Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>
To: Michael moyer <michaelmoyer@live.com>
Date Sent: Tuesday, January 2, 2024 3:01:20 PM GMT-08:00
A glimmer of hope...
See inline in red below.
From: Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>
Sent: Tuesday, January 2, 2024 9:55 AM
To: Chris�ne Moyer <
chris�nemoyer@hotmail.com>
Cc: Rob Moyer <
rob.moyer@gmail.com>

Per our discussion, I think this is what we discussed and additional ideas I had. Open to feedback. As mentioned,
we can use the moving service app for some quick hits and then work on a longer-term plan. We also need to
figure out the former love nest clean/move.
Shared Furniture to minimize cash outlay
TVs : Sitting room & Deck (might ask to swap one for living room TV). OK
Furniture: I will move our sitting room and guest room stuff to new place. I may look at Furnish to
replacement items for sitting room. If Furnish items fit better in your place, you may prefer that from a
measurement perspective. OK for guest room
Patio: We agree it's not used, so I will take, but we can truly divide in mediation. OK
Grills: Happy to share these if you like. The beach grill would be great for ya. You can take all the grills. I
will not use them. Does this include the green egg? If not, I can arrange for the dump.
Misc: bean bag? exercise stuff? art? pillows? desk? Is there anything in the man cave? Can take bean bag
from man cave, Pelloton, Stair Master, desk all from Man Cave. I have nice Crate and Barrel art pieces that
are not hanging up that you can take a look at and decide. You can also take the Moose in living room,
cows head on porch.
Kitchen: Realistic division of shared assets, I think you are working on that. Do you want the Crate and
Barrel yellow plateware set? I pulled out the SBUX set that I bought 10 plus years ago, and have started to
use that. LMK if you want the white
porcelain set that was on wedding registry. Its barely used. and the
plateware Christmas set from your mom. Just LMK.
Decorations: We can work together in the near term and use long-term mediation. OK
Linens/Towels: I have a bunch from the beach, but I will want nice stuff. Suggestions? Both households
could use a refresh.
Other furniture for consideration
Master bedroom: I can use beach stuff as a temp option. We swap the mattresses. Agree
Dining Table: I can use the beach one as a temp. The chairs have to go, though. OK.
Beach Couch/Chair: I'll keep my chair and use the couch till we get something better. I thought you were
taking the sitting room set? If yes, I will replace with something from Furnish.
Beach Bean Bag: I'll find a place to use that somewhere, do we have an extra at home? Yes - assumed you
will take it.
Kids bedroom set: I can use the one at the beach for AD, and use the guest for Max. OK
One kid's desk: We need two. I'll take the beach one and find a new one (1210 or Craigslist). We have the
black pottery barn one in the Man cave.
TV room sectional. You keep ours. I will rent or buy. Hopefully, it's the only cash outlay. OK.
Kids "fun stuff" I may think about
Electronics: PCs, Monitors, gaming (we have some of this)
Play: CL or Amazon "Pop a shot" game?
Play: CL or Amazon Basketball hoop?
Play: CL or Amazon Ping Pong table?
Pets: Fish/Gerbils/Cat/Dog?
I want to be super clear- I still prefer to nest as we said. This will be much more expensive. But, I understand your concerns
and wish things that happened since July had not happened, making it so hard. But I still want to work with you so we are
not forced to do dumb fiscal things again.

Subject: Re: Dad on the Eastside in 2024
From: Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>
To: Lisa Ann Sharpe <sharpe@lasher.com>
Cc: "William Reingold, Jr." <reingold@lasher.com>, "Vanessa G. Woods" <woods@lasher.com>
Date Sent: Tuesday, January 2, 2024 2:21:52 PM GMT-08:00
Date Received: Tuesday, January 2, 2024 2:21:53 PM GMT-08:00
As would I.... lol w
From: Lisa Ann Sharpe <sharpe@lasher.com>

Outlook for iOS
From: Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>
Sent: Tuesday, January 2, 2024 4:10 PM
To: chris�ne moyer <chris�nemoyer@hotmail.com>

CL is HARD... lol...
What I could use help on is what the good brands are kinda stack ranked.. lol Restoration Hardware, Room & Board, West
Elm, -> Crate and Barrel, Wayfair, Ikea, Ashley...
I think the choice is either just renting something high-end like you from Fernish or getting something from a Wayfair, and
dividing it up in mediation. I am torn between the long-term value of the rent option versus buying cheap and then getting
rid of it. It might be helpful to understand the brand and cost of ours now. However, I would never presume to buy another
like that until we part ways and know where we will live long-term.

Let's discuss the options in more detail before practice tonight. I will likely coach his team, so I hope we can make this a
priority. So I would like to understand the Ski vs AAU plans we need to adjust if that happens.

Subject: Fwd: January Newsletter
From: Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>
To: Christine Moyer <christinemoyer@hotmail.com>
Date Sent: Wednesday, January 3, 2024 10:59:07 AM GMT-08:00
I am trying to figure out what happened to the Winter Schedule. It's not in TeamSnap but I know I saw it and even shared it
with you. But for now it looks like there would be no Rec league conflict. That said, I'd like to get him to some of the Shoot
360 camps on Sat if it works with his schedule. Thanks1

We hope 2023 was everything you hoped it would be. We are having an
amazing Winter season. Here is a quick update on our current season:
Our boys & girls travel to California this Winter to face national
competition.  Both groups had the opportunity to travel and grow
together as a unit and are on a roll this Winter. 12u Gold team is
currently 7-0 in the NIKE Made Hoops circuit and is in 1st place. Very
strong group that is already making national noise early. A team to keep
an eye on over the next few years. We finish off Winter season with the
ADIDAS Presidents Day Classic in Portland which has been touted as
one of the best tournaments on the west coast! Our Lions League
athletes just got brand new uniforms this season and are putting in work
every week with a hyper focus on development and game reps. In
Spring 2024 we will host our 2nd annual Lions League All-Star weekend!
We are very excited to roll out our 2024 plans as well! Here are some
quick updates:

The best time of year is right around the corner. With over 1,200 athletes
at Spring 2023 tryouts, this will be our biggest and best tryout yet! We
can not wait for everyone to see some of the new additions we have

We will have tryouts for boys & girls grades 1-12th. Our season will run
through end of June for 8th and under and July for our national travel

Saturday Skills Training @Shoot360 in
Ki kl  d

We are excited to announce our first weekend skills training program at
Shoot 360! This Saturday from 9-10am we will host our offensive game
training. Come join us early Saturday and work on your game in one of

You do NOT have to be a current LOCALHOOPS or Shoot360 member in order to

Saturday Game Training @Shoot360
Our final camp of Winter season is right before Spring tryouts. We will be
back at Shoot 360 all week during Mid-Winter Break for our skills camp:
February 20-23rd from 9:00am-12:00pm. We will have full week and

We plan to have our Summer Camp line up out by February 1st. Our
next camp after Mid-Winter will be Spring Break April 8-12th. Stay tuned

We have a few more announcements we will be making as we get closer
to Spring season. We hope this email finds you well and we hope to see

~ The LOCALHOOPS Team

https://www.localhoops.org/
LOCALHOOPS Training Academy
, Bellevue, WA
